title: French Open Loses Two of Its Biggest Names in One Day
summary: Past champions Serena Williams and Naomi Osaka both fall to unseeded players. After a slow opening week at the French Open that had little thunder, two of the game's most famous women-Serena Williams and Naomi Osaka-are now both gone.

title: Military Reviews Handling of White House Request to Obscure USS John McCain
summary: Navy officials haven't determined how long it took before the initial directive and its suspension. The U.S. military is reviewing the handling of a White House request to move "out of sight" the USS John S. McCain during President Trump's trip to Japan last week and doesn't yet have a clear picture of what happened, U.S. officials said Saturday.

title: White House Special Counsel Emmet Flood to Depart
summary: Flood joined the White House to help with the Russia investigation. WASHINGTON-President Trump said Saturday that Emmet Flood, a lawyer who joined the White House to help with the Russia investigation, would leave the job on June 14.

title: Virginia Beach Grieves Deaths of 12 Shooting Victims
summary: Eleven of the victims were city employees, with tenures ranging from 11 months to more than 40 years; 'They leave a void that we will never be able to fill'. A grieving Virginia Beach, Va., woke up Saturday to learn the names of the 12 people gunned down by a longtime city employee who authorities say turned a municipal building into a sea of carnage.

title: Tariffs on Mexican Imports Would Hit More Than Avocados in Grocery Stores
summary: Grocers say 5% might be bearable but worry what would happen if the tariff hits 25%. President Trump's threat to slap escalating tariffs on Mexican imports could drive up the price of tomatoes, strawberries and many other foods in U.S. grocery stores and restaurants.

title: Justice Department Prepares Antitrust Investigation of Google
summary: Probe would closely examine Google's practices related to search, other businesses. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department is gearing up for an antitrust investigation of Alphabet Inc.'s Google, a move that could present a major new layer of regulatory scrutiny for the search giant, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: FedEx Caught in U.S.-China Tensions
summary: National agencies reported to be investigating whether FedEx failed to make deliveries to intended recipients and harmed Chinese customers. SHANGHAI-Chinese authorities are investigating FedEx Corp. over allegations it damaged the interest of customers, state media reported, in the first action against a U.S. company amid U.S.-China heightening tensions over trade and technology.

title: Too Much Time Under the Heat Lamp for DoorDash
summary: Venture-capital investors seem content to fund DoorDash's market-share war. But that could leave little upside in an eventual public offering. Privately held DoorDash is currently as hot as the food it delivers. Will it overheat from overfunding?

title: This Selective New York School Has Found a Formula for Diversity
summary: At Manhattan Hunter Science High School on the Upper West Side, about half of the roughly 440 students are black or Hispanic, and most are low-income.

title: Sept. 11 Changed the Course of His Life From Options Trader to Educator
summary: Shaken by the terrorist attack, Kevin Froner vowed to find a new career doing something more meaningful.

title: Chelsea Supersizes Its Art Scene With Mega-Galleries
summary: To keep up with the high-flying art world, gallery owners are opting for museum-like spaces. For two decades, the western edge of Manhattan's Chelsea neighborhood has been New York's de facto gallery district, with dozens of places of all sizes to see contemporary art.

title: Winning Bid to Have Lunch With Warren Buffett: $4.6 Million
summary: Annual auction to dine with the Berkshire Hathaway chairman raises money for a San Francisco charity. An anonymous fan bid a record $4,567,888 in a charity auction to have lunch with Warren Buffett.

title: The Golden State Warriors (and Their Opponents) Through the Years
summary: Resume Subscription. The Golden State Warriors have made it to five straight NBA Finals, a stretch of sustained basketball success that's unprecedented in the league's modern era, and they have been around for so long that they have aged right in front of us. Steve Kerr no longer bothers wearing a necktie. Stephen Curry is now so old that he can actually grow facial hair. Klay Thompson-well, Klay Thompson looks almost exactly the same. Players have come (Kevin Durant and DeMarcus Cousins) and Warriors have gone (David Lee and Harrison Barnes). There have even been Warriors who have come and gone (Andrew Bogut).

title: 'Changing and Unchanging Things: Noguchi and Hasegawa in Postwar Japan' Review: Beauty Without Borders
summary: An exhibition at the Noguchi Museum looks at how two great artists navigated the globalized cultural world and were inspired, at home and abroad.. Long Island City, N.Y.

title: Doctors Said She'd Die Before High School. But She Wanted to Go to College.
summary: Resume Subscription. South Bend, Indiana

title: U.S. Will Face China's Behavior in Asia Directly, Defense Secretary Says
summary: 'It's not about being confrontational. It's about being open and having a dialogue.'. SINGAPORE-In his first major public appearance in Asia, acting Defense Secretary Pat Shanahan said the U.S. would no longer "ignore Chinese behavior" in the Asia-Pacific region, calling its activity a "tool kit of coercion."

title: Asian Startups Scrap Over Shared Scooters
summary: Young companies use lessons learned from taxi, bike battles to take on bigger U.S. companies like Lime. SINGAPORE-Dozens of young companies burned through billions of dollars vying to dominate ride-hailing and bike-sharing in Asian megacities from Beijing to Jakarta. The race to transform urban transport is still on and now a fresh pileup looms-over electric scooters.

title: Highlights of Commencement 2019
summary: As college graduation season wraps up, Robert Smith's pledge to pay off Morehouse graduates' debts breaks the mold; many speeches address climate change.

title: Phantom Yields Boost JPMorgan EMBI Indexes
summary: The bank's popular indexes for emerging-market bonds overstate yields with defaulted Venezuelan debt.

title: Factories Stall on Strong Dollar, Trade Tensions
summary: Manufacturers facing headwinds portend slower economic growth. U.S. manufacturers are having a hard time mounting an encore to last year's strong performance.

title: Ex-Wall Street Lawyer Advocates Return of Postal Banking
summary: Mehrsa Baradaran says financial crisis taught her that banking and government are inextricably linked. As a young Wall Street lawyer, Mehrsa Baradaran helped large banks turn to the government to survive the financial crisis. A decade later, she is behind a proposal to bring government-backed competition into their world.

title: Airlines to Consider Path to Resuming Boeing 737 MAX Flights
summary: Ethiopian Airlines remains uncertain about future of the plane in its fleet. SEOUL- Boeing Co. 737 MAX operators plan to meet late this month to discuss how to return the aircraft to the sky after two fatal crashes led to its global grounding.

title: Judge Lets Missouri's Only Abortion Clinic Stay Open for Now
summary: Planned Parenthood had challenged state's refusal to renew license, which was set to expire at midnight. A Missouri circuit judge ruled Friday that the state's only abortion clinic can keep its license for now, the latest development as states move to stake out positions amid a growing belief that federal rules on the procedure could soon be changing.

title: Theresa May Should Have Listened to John Adams
summary: To win support for high-stakes votes on independence, May and Adams used starkly different strategies, but only one of them worked. In the early summer of 1776, John Adams had grown profoundly exasperated.

title: Modi and India Don't Need Western Values
summary: The largely Oxbridge-based Western sociopolitical and economic framework that was imposed on India failed the vast majority of Indians.. Tunku Varadarajan's lament about India's spurning of Western values is a common refrain of India's deracinated elite since Narendra Modi was elected ("India Turns West but Away From Western Values," op-ed, May 24). It stems in part from an inability to accept that the largely Oxbridge-based sociopolitical and economic framework that was imposed on India failed the vast majority of Indians. There is no better example of that than the fact that the amalgam of Western ideas that is the Indian constitution has had to be amended over a hundred times since independence. The secular ideals extolled by that elite drove a stake into the heart of Indian aspirations as it limited the expressions of religious beliefs for Hindus while protecting some truly repressive laws applicable to Muslim women.

title: What's the Right Way to Address Huawei?
summary: Huawei has to a great extent passed from the model of catchup, imitation and, yes, theft, to one whereby it is innovating and seen by the U.S. as a strategic threat to its technology hegemony.. "China's Tech Champion-Or Serial Thief?" (Exchange, May 25) assembles evidence of theft dating back 10 to 15 years, but fails to give sufficient credit to Huawei Technologies Co. today as an innovator. Through being an avid learner of Western business practices and through spending 15% of its revenues on research and development, Huawei has to a great extent passed from the model of catchup, imitation and, yes, theft, to one whereby it is innovating and seen by the U.S. as a strategic threat to its technology hegemony. Huawei's pricing on telecoms infrastructure equipment is below that of its foreign competitors. But Huawei's value proposition isn't just about price but also about having achieved mission-critical quality and excellent levels of service.

title: How the Chief Executive of Bonobos Finds Helpful, 'No Fluff' Advice
summary: Micky Onvural turns to close friends and fellow CEOs for guidance, but also uses whimsical exercises to shift perspectives; pulling the swan card with her executive coach. Soon after becoming chief executive of men's clothing brand Bonobos, Micky Onvural had a revelation.

title: Amazon's Plan to Move In to Your Next Apartment Before You Do
summary: The tech giant has figured out a way to get millions of its smart speakers into homes without consumers lifting a finger, as property managers bring in Alexa to manage tenants.

title: How to Have Lunch With Warren Buffett
summary: It costs at least $4.5 million in a charity auction. But that probably includes onion rings.. Human beings really want to have lunch with Warren Buffett. Late Friday, with a few hours left to make a bid, someone offered more than $4.5 million in a charity auction for the opportunity to dine with the famed investor. That's quite a bit more than anyone would bid to have lunch with me. I am fairly sure a lunch with me would fetch, at most, three dollars. And that's if I'm paying the bill.

title: Virginia Beach Shooting Leaves at Least 12 Dead
summary: The suspected shooter was a longtime city employee and died in the incident. A longtime city employee who had been terminated entered a municipal building in Virginia Beach, Va., Friday afternoon to exact revenge, law-enforcement officials said. He shot indiscriminately, killing at least 12 and injuring at least four others.

title: Trump's Threat of Tariffs on Mexico Prompts Outcry
summary: Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer argued bid to stem migrant flow could jeopardize trade accord. WASHINGTON-A day after President Trump threatened to impose across-the-board tariffs on Mexico if it doesn't crack down on the flow of migrants into the U.S., business groups and lawmakers expressed opposition to the plan, while the Mexican government said it would meet with the U.S. to explore a diplomatic solution.
